CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: András Sajó;Antonella Mularoni;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG found that there had been a violation of LAW , following an application lodged by the applicant on DATE ( PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL ) concerning the length of criminal proceedings brought against him for his membership of Dev - Yol ( NORP Way ) . By then the proceedings had lasted for DATE . ORG awarded the applicant MONEY ( MONEY ) in compensation .
CARDINAL . At the time of the ORG ’s judgment , the criminal proceedings against the applicant were still pending before ORG .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case thereafter , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant attended a hearing before ORG , gave a statement and submitted the ORG ’s judgment of DATE in order to ensure that his case would be heard within a reasonable time .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG sentenced the applicant to death , and then commuted his sentence to life imprisonment . The judgment was subject to appeal .

CARDINAL . In the meantime in DATE , LAW was amended so that the death penalty could no longer be ordered or implemented other than in time of war or of imminent threat of war , or for acts of terrorism . Subsequently , by PERSON no . CARDINAL , which was published on DATE , ORG resolved , inter alia , to abolish the death penalty in peacetime .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of the first - instance court on the ground that the death penalty had been abolished during the course of the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG resumed the trial . On DATE it ordered , in absentia , the provisional detention of the applicant in order to secure a statement from him .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG heard a statement from the applicant as regards the state of the case and revoked the detention order as having served its purpose . Subsequently , ORG held DATE more hearings .
CARDINAL . On DATE , at its fourteenth hearing , ORG delivered its judgment and sentenced the applicant to life imprisonment pursuant to LAW .
CARDINAL . According to the information made available to the ORG by the parties to date , the case is apparently still pending before ORG .
